info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Fulton and central Montgomery Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fonda, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban/poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Fonda, Ephratah, Tribes Hill, Glen, Berkshire, Fultonville, Auriesville, Meco, West Perth, Sprakers, Sammonsville, Flat Creek, Rockwood, Davis Corners, Hale Mills, Rural Grove, McKinley and East Stone Arabia. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
